node.display_long_description:
- 与无法用语言沟通的谜之少女卡蒂娅一起体验奇妙之旅。
由曾为《合金装备5：幻痛》中Quiet配音的Stefanie Joosten在本作中担任卡蒂娅的声优。
由曾为《圣剑传说2》和《灵魂能力5》制作音乐的菊田裕树负责本作的音乐制作。

- 你可以体验到10小时以上的解密流程与多个独特的游戏结局。与卡蒂娅一起在VR世界里体验一段独一无二的冒险旅程。

- 由曾经参与过《随身玩伴多罗猫》，《食人的大鹫》，《古堡迷踪（ICO）》，《汪达与巨像》等人气项目的经验丰富的开发者共同制作。

- 支持Oculus Rift/Quest Cross-buy

通过VR体验奇妙之旅。
～和无法语言交流的少女、共同逃脱密室～

『Last Labyrinth』是一款以「VR时代的全新冒险类游戏」为设计理念而开发出的VR密室逃脱冒险游戏，玩家可在该游戏中享受到只有VR才能带来的世界观架构和与虚拟角色互动的全新体验。被困在谜之宅邸里玩家，将和遇见的谜之少女【卡蒂娅】齐心协力，一边解决各种谜题一边尝试逃脱迷宫。
  
　本款游戏由《随身玩伴多罗猫》系列的策划・监制高橋宏典亲自操刀。此外，曾担任过《食人的大鹫》《剪刀王子》等游戏设计和关卡设计的渡邉哲也也参与了共同策划・监制。《古堡迷踪（ICO）》《汪达与巨像》角色动画的担当福山敦子担任动画主美一职，『GT赛车３ A-Spec』『GT赛车４』景观设计的担当草場美智子担任环境主美一职，《怪物农场》《超级机器人大战》系列的声音/音效担当花岡拓也担任声音设计一职等等，本款游戏集结了多位资深成员。他们齐心协力共同攻克难题----通过VR实现和谜之少女卡蒂娅的非语言交流。

谜之少女卡蒂娅的声优担当是活跃在国内外舞台上的模特・演员・歌手的Stefanie Joosten，她曾在『METAL GEAR SOLID V:THE PHANTOM PAIN』中扮演过有语言障碍的美丽狙击手「Quiet」。

主题曲由曾创作过『聖剑传说2』、『聖剑传说3』等无数游戏音乐的菊田裕树作曲。曾在「Quiet's Theme 」中一展歌喉的Stefanie Joosten担任主题曲主唱

node.reviewDescription:
An incredibly unique and well-polished title is Last Labyrinth. A mixture of horror, escape-room and puzzle the game oozes a Saw-like atmosphere and is really not what we were expecting after seeing the cover art. We really love the idea of you essentially being just an observant to the horrors in front of you, chained to your wheelchair with very limited movement in your hands and head (a true made-for-seated-VR experience), it gives you a deep sense of helplessness. You guide a young Asian girl through a house filled with puzzle-traps that can result in the gory demise of you and/or the girl. The developers seriously don’t hold back how visceral they make the traps, if you’re into horror movies you’ll be grinning ear to ear like a crazed lunatic.

With nothing but a laser pointer and ‘yes’ and ‘no’ responses via head nods and shakes, it’s up to you to instruct the girl what to do to open the next room's door. The game doesn’t hold back and after the first room’s puzzle throws you straight into the deep end. The first proper puzzle had us, well, puzzled for a good 15-20 minutes, trying numerous variations before it suddenly clicked what we had to do. As horror fans ourselves we were delighted by the game’s attitude of not holding back. Don’t mess up, or you’re dead – and you’ll soon realise when you’ve made that fatal mistake.

This is the closest at the moment that you’d get to a Saw VR game and it’s not a bad start by a long shot. Our negatives would be that it's not made clear the child is speaking in a fictional language, leading you to believe you messed up the language settings presented when you boot up the game. I assumed she was speaking Japanese and I needed to turn on subtitles somewhere. But it’s actually intentional and used to create a real language barrier between the two of you. The pacing and movement can also feel incredibly slow at times.

Read the full review and more: https://www.opiumpulses.com/article/411/10-more-oculus-quest-game-reviews-p2
